p: The PV is used as the quantity measurement for peroxides, which are intermediate products of lipid oxidation. The PV test is a good way to determine the amount of primary oxidation products in freshly extracted seed oil. The PV of cold-pressed PSO from unpretreated seeds was relatively low (0.73 meqO 2/kg PSO). After seed blanching and microwave heating, the PV significantly ( p < 0.05) increased by 11 and 18%, although no significant differences were observed between the PV of oils extracted from microwave-heated and blanched seeds ( Table 1). Nevertheless, the PVs (0.73â€“0.86 meqO 2/kg PSO) from all oil samples were far below the level (15 meqO 2/kg oil) established by the World Health Organization (WHO) under the Codex Alimentarius Commission, indicating that the oils were of good quality and acceptable at the international market [ 43]. The lower values of peroxides in the oil samples may result from the lower extraction temperatures during oil pressing.
